Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Seal impression
Description: An impression of a seal, a unique piece bearing a print on its base, allowing for the authenticity of parcels or mail to be controlled upon their arrival. The object represented here, made of terra sigillata, was suspended from a cord which also left its print. The motif of the seal is quite common: a round spiral enclosing the formula "Re is great".
